thread.title: U.S. Conducts Criminal Probe of Volkswagen, Sources Say
thread.title_full: U.S. Conducts Criminal Probe of Volkswagen, Sources Say - WSJ

author: Aruna Viswanatha
title: U.S. Conducts Criminal Probe of Volkswagen, Sources Say
text:
7 COMMENTS The U.S. Justice Department is conducting a criminal probe of Volkswagen AG VLKAY -17.10 % over the auto maker’s alleged cheating on U.S. emissions tests, people familiar with the matter said.
The Justice Department’s Environment and Natural Resources Division is conducting the probe, the people said Monday.
A Volkswagen spokeswoman declined to comment. Chief Executive Martin Winterkorn has said the company is cooperating with authorities and has commissioned an external probe in the matter.
The probe adds to deepening woes for the German auto maker, which is under investigation by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and is facing pressure from the German government over the allegations. The EPA on Friday disclosed allegations that Volkswagen deliberately dodged air-pollution rules on 482,000 diesel-powered cars sold since 2008. The EPA earlier said it was authorized to refer the matter to the Justice Department.
Bloomberg earlier reported the Justice Department probe.
Write to Aruna Viswanatha at aruna.viswanatha@wsj.com
